result.execSummary:
The defendant Lavert Trudo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during probation; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Court waived all non mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant is advised he/she may not possess any firearms.
- NO CONTACT with victim K.A.B., B.A.D., N.H.

- Mental Health Assessment and cooperate with any programs recommended by the probation department.
- Complete a Parenting Class.
- Complete Batterers Intervention Class.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lavert Trudo

03:58 PM Defendant Lavert Trudo in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 9-30-22 at 10:00 am in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional status conference.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Lavert Trudo in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
